item.title: Google Photos brings its prompt-based editing feature to India, Australia and Japan
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Users can describe their edits in natural language to modify an image.

item.title: India’s Shadowfax slips on listing, as client concentration spooks investors
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Shadowfax shares fell about 9% on theirdebut, valuing the logistics firm near its last private valuation.

item.title: What you should know about the owners of US TikTok
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: ​ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese parent company, recently established a separate American entity to run the app’s U.S. operations. This restructuring aims to separate U.S. TikTok from its Chinese parent, addressing concerns about data privacy and foreign control. The move came after years of pressure from lawmakers, who feared the Chinese government’s potential access to Americans’ data. […]

item.title: Everything you need to know about viral personal AI assistant Clawdbot (now Moltbot)
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Personal AI assistant Moltbot —formerly Clawdbot — has gone viral in a matter of weeks. But there’s more you should know before jumping on the bandwagon.

item.title: Fashion rental app By Rotation and Uber partner to help deliver ski clothing
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: By Rotation, one of the U.K.’s most popular peer-to-peer fashion rental platforms, is partnering with Uber to deliver ski clothes.

item.title: Anduril has invented a wild new drone-flying contest where jobs are the prize
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: This is a race series for software programmers and the brainchild of founder Palmer Luckey, he tells TechCrunch.

item.title: Bluesky teases 2026 roadmap: A better Discover feed, real-time features, and more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Bluesky is teasing new features and improvements ranging from the Discover feed to video support.

item.title: Anthropic reportedly upped its latest raise to $20B
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Anthropic looks to raise $20 billion at more than $300 billion valuation, according to reports.

item.title: Amazon agrees to pay consumers $309M in returns policy settlement
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The lawsuit, filed in 2023, alleged that Amazon caused "substantial unjustified monetary losses” for consumers who returned an item but were still charged for it.

item.title: TikTok joins Snap to settle social media addiction lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Jury selection begins Tuesday as this case moves closer to trial.

item.title: Anthropic and OpenAI CEOs condemn ICE violence, praise Trump
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Anthropic's Dario Amodei and OpenAI's Sam Altman spoke out against ICE enforcement tactics following Minneapolis violence, with one addressing concerns publicly and the other in an internal message.

item.title: Google’s more affordable AI Plus plan rolls out to all markets, including the US
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Gemini 3 Pro and other AI tools are now available globally through the Google AI Plus plan, which is $7.99 per month in the United States.

item.title: OpenAI launches Prism, a new AI workspace for scientists
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: OpenAI has launched a new scientific workspace program called Prism, which integrates AI into existing standards for composing research papers.

item.title: Amid Trump attacks and weaponized sanctions, Europeans look to rely less on US tech
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: European governments are looking to move away from U.S. tech and reclaim their digital sovereignty at a time of unpredictability and volatility in the United States.

item.title: The price gap between Waymo and Uber is narrowing
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: A trip in a Waymo robotaxi still costs more, on average, than a comparable ride in a human-driven Uber or a Lyft. But that gap is narrowing, according to new data published Tuesday by Obi, a company that aggregates real-time pricing and pickup times across multiple ride-hailing services.

item.title: If you live in the UK, you probably won’t be able to visit Pornhub anymore
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Pornhub parent company Aylo will restrict access from U.K. users, rather than comply with age-verification mandates, which the company said it believes have not succeeded in promoting online safety.

item.title: TikTok says it’s still working to recover its US infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: TikTok says some of the glitches continue but it's making "significant progress" in recovering its U.S. infrastructure.

item.title: WhatsApp is rolling out a new stricter security setting to protect users from cyberattacks
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Strict Account Settings adds restrictions like automatically blocking media and attachments from unknown senders, and silencing calls from unknown numbers.

item.title: Google now lets users jump from AI Overviews into AI Mode conversations
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The tech giant also announced that it's making Gemini 3 the new default model for AI Overviews globally.

item.title: Android phones are getting more anti-theft features
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Google says Android devices will get new security features, like stronger authentication safeguards and enhanced recovery tools.
